website_summaries.verdict: The most secure and trusted multi-functional hardware wallet.
pros: Unmatched security for multiple crypto currencies
Protects access to servers, data, or website administration
SSH login with single or multiple sessions
cons: USB wire is short and may limit usage

customer_reviews.title: My preferred crypto wallet after trying them all. Be aware of the limited crypto coin support and do your research
customer_reviews.text: This should be the first thing you buy when you reach $100 in BTC. Solid unit. The web wallet leaves a lot to be desired, but functions perfectly with Electrum, including the mobile executable. It does have a somewhat limited coin selection that it works with, so pay attention to that before you purchase. It works with about 75% of my crypto portfolio, and they roll out new coins somewhat often. Record your seed words, practice restoring with your seed words, and keep them in a safe place!!! 100% open source and peer vetted.
customer_reviews.author: Rob BTop Contributor: Amazon Echo

customer_reviews.title: Product stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This item malfunctioned the third time I used it. It powers on but no computer will recognize it AFTER I loaded crypto currencies on it. Customer service has not been able to solve via email, the only available method.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Rafferty

customer_reviews.title: Best Hardware Wallet
customer_reviews.text: If you do anything with crypto coins you know the importance of securing your private keys. Private keys never leave this device and unlike software wallets they are never in computer memory where they are potentially exposed to hackers and malware.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Only way to safely store crypto
customer_reviews.text: The only safe way to store your Cryptocurreny and Bitcoin. If you're not using this for $100, it may be the worst decision of your crypto career. $100 for piece of mind is absolutely worth every penny. Easy to use, safe, and it's nice having something physical. Look at that little guy, so tiny! Only reason it did not get 5 stars is because the casing is flimsy and the rope broke the plastic off in the first week. Still holds my coin though!!
customer_reviews.author: Squirrel Master

customer_reviews.title: Short life and bad business
customer_reviews.text: I bought my Trezor in September 2017. The other day it was working fine until I installed the Bridge update at the Trezor site. Immediately afterwards, my Trezor stopped functioning completely. The folks at Trezor said they can't help me because I bought it through Amazon and wished me good luck. 'nuff said.
customer_reviews.author: George Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money, the thing is so small and it even rattles! It froze half way through install and now the computer wont recognize it, cant fix. wasted 180 bucks. Youll feel ripped off if you buy the trezor.
customer_reviews.author: joe kirkendoll

customer_reviews.title: Firmware is faulty - my upgrade lost all of my stored cryptocurrency
customer_reviews.text: Be very careful with firmware updates!! I updated mine and lost all of my cryptocurrency on the device, despite following to the letter all of the precautions and backup steps. This should not happen and the manufacturer knows it does because it spends an extraordinary amout of time cautioning a user about this situation. Hardware wallets are supposed to be the safest way to guard your BTC - this one is most assuredly NOT. Would not recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Curt Bouler

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 2.5 years.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first hardware wallet. Bought it a little over two years ago. Recently took it out of the safe and it was dead. The screen was black. Tried a different USB cord and port but no go. Contacted support and they suggested a trying a different USB cord and port - which I already did :/ Fortunately, I had my seed and restored to a Ledger wallet. Wow, the ledger wallet is more solid and seems better quality overall. I have a feeling it'll last more than 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Clean

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working - lost everything
customer_reviews.text: After a year and several thousand dollars stored here, I cannot get help from the company and it will not work despite updating firmware, chrome, etc. Dont waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Ruff!

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I previously bought the Ledger Nano duo. I did not realize the two were connected to the same account. The Nano makes you use a decoding card when you withdraw from it. If I ever lost the card I would be in trouble. The trezor seems more secure, has step by step instructions and videos. The layout is nicer and more functionality. It also keeps more types of currencies. It's a matter of a pin that controls it. So much better than ledger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great unit. Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Great unit. Simple to use, but the included instructions are lacking. Google is your friend when setting this up. Hint, you need to download and install Google Chrome and a plugin to use this. Once configured it's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: One of my worst buys - missed the BCH fork because of this stick
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to move BCH to this stick, but the provided address was not accepted at the exchange because it was BECH32, which seems that nobody else is using and there was not even a hint on the TREZOR support page, so I missed the ABC / SV fork and lost lots of money. Also set-up is very very difficult, annoying and not straight forward. Stick is too small (display) and I need a magnifier to read it. After my first bad experience with losing money I've decided not to use it and now it's just a lost $100 for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: 1 downside but its big
customer_reviews.text: Good price, came quick. It is much smaller than I thought it would be (about the size of a sub drive). It is very easy to set up and use. Glad I got it. The only annoying thing is that it won't let you use the Trezor interface to view and manage your ethereum. It forces you to download and use a 2nd interface that comes from ethereum which is much more confusing and definitely pointless. Its extra sad because the trezor interface is really easy to navigate. So if you have ether be prepared for an extra pain in the ass.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Trader

customer_reviews.title: It sucks. The reason why that is because the Trezor ...
customer_reviews.text: It sucks. The reason why that is because the Trezor wallet would not install or initiate properly when I attempted to activate the device in order to setup my account using the device. Trezor seems like a good brand but the one I received was garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Spitfire

customer_reviews.title: Ended up giving this away as a gift due to potential MITM attack.
customer_reviews.text: Trezor is the best hardware wallet for Bitcoin that I’ve used yet. I like that I can customize the front, I chose the Times of London paper. It’s one of the most versatile bitcoin hardware wallets, and it’s founded by cyberpunk bitcoiners. I don’t really trust buying cryptocurrency wallets on amazon for myself. You never know what happens in between. It’s best to buy direct from the manufacturer if you want to avoid there being a Man In The Middle attack. I ended up giving this one away as a gift because I’m a bit paranoid.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Mills

customer_reviews.title: Good but not easy to learn
customer_reviews.text: This crypto wallet works, but it is not easy to use. I have bitcoin, ethereum and ethereum classic stored on it. The web support is also not that user friendly. I may like it more as I use it more, but getting started is frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce L.

customer_reviews.title: Trezor > Ledger Nano S
customer_reviews.text: I have both Trezor and Ledger Nano S, I really prefer the Trezor over the Nano S. The initial setup is way less cumbersome with the Trezor, also, the Chrome apps and trezor bridge are easier to use than the Ledger ones, there is also no need to "install" any apps onto the hardware wallet itself, it just works with BTC and ETH out of the box. Upgrading the firmware on the Trezor is also way simpler than doing that on the Nano S. Overall I find myself using the Trezor a lot more and would definitely go with Trezor if I need more hardware wallets.
customer_reviews.author: ayn

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Belongs in a trash can.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work on my Windows 10 machine. Wouldn't install firmware. Tried everything. Sucks. Hate it. Garbage. Expensive junk, built cheaply.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you do your research if you plan to ...
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you do your research if you plan to get into other cryptocoins. The Trezor does not support XRP but the ledgar does. I was on the fence about which one to get and ended up opting for the Trezor. I decided to buy some XRP and it is not supported so I had to buy a ledgar as well.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Stopped connecting and no tech support
customer_reviews.text: I've used the Trezor twice. The first time I went through the manual with it and made a small bitcoin purchase. The second time it's plugged into the USB but listed as disconnected. It lights up but pressing the two buttons only gives me the option of locking the Trezor which I don't want to do. Here's the biggest problem. There is no support phone number or even email address I can find. I highly urge others not to invest in a highly technical and less than intuitive device like this without the availability of phone support especially in the learning stages. Big mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Larry B.

customer_reviews.title: Better than the competition.
customer_reviews.text: This device is MUCH more user friendly than the competitor. The competitor lost my funds for about a week when their API went down. This device works like a charm - instantly see funds coming and going, calculates fees correctly for the current market conditions, smaller and more convenient than the others. Spend the extra money on a wallet that won’t go down due to third party API issues!
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I had unreasonable expectations.
customer_reviews.text: It's a hardware wallet, but I was disappointed with it. Maybe I had unreasonable expectations. I bought this after hearing about how important it was to keep private keys for your cryptocurrency safe, but was disappointed when I found out how very few cryptographic assets are actually supported by this device. If Bitcoin is the only thing you plan on holding then this will work great, but I have tried to get into some altcoins and unfortunately this doesn't do anything to protect those. I know there are more coins that they are planning to be supported but as of mid 2018 the list is still disappointingly short.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska Computer Guy

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Where do i even start with this thing...easy to use, no complicated set up and even has a password manager..not many realize this...I no longer use my other password manager which has more vulnerabilities. Now I feel completely secure even if my PC gets infected with Malware or a key logger..excellent product
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Also there aren't many "alt" coins supported on the hardware wallet which is super disappointing. I doubt they will add many more ...
customer_reviews.text: Eth isn't supported on the Trezor website. Instead it takes you to a link to another website where you have access to your eth. Also there aren't many "alt" coins supported on the hardware wallet which is super disappointing. I doubt they will add many more anytime soon but we'll see. I also dislike the little string that comes with it. It is too thin and can break with no force at all and you'll lose your $150 wallet. The actual Trezor is super small and thin. I myself expect maybe too much from products/people so take that into consideration when reading my review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Non Functional
customer_reviews.text: Got it. Plugged it in. Followed the instructions. It won't connect. It tells me to start a firmware update. The update fails. No useful information or recourse.
customer_reviews.author: George Reese

customer_reviews.title: Poor Ethereum integration with myetherwallet
customer_reviews.text: Terrible integration with myetherwallet for handling Ether. Still doesn't properly handle ERC20 tokens - displays gibberish on Trezor making it insecure.
customer_reviews.author: Discreet Me

customer_reviews.title: Nice small device to secure your crypto
customer_reviews.text: Love this unit so far. I've put about $1000 worth of crypto on it so far, and feel very secure having it there. I went to buy another one for a good friend of mine, but the price had shot up between the time I bought mine and the time I went to buy the second one. I have long term plans for using this device, so I do hope they add support for some other currencies down the road. But I'm very happy with it at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: If you are at all into cryptocurrency, a physical hardware wallet is a must have. It's like a Fort Knox for your crypto that fits into your pocket. The security features on this thing are incredibly complex, yet the interface is designed in such a way that makes it very easy to use. It is a great invention. It does extremely complex tasks with an extremely friendly user interface; the way all great machines are designed. At $36.00, I think it's a great deal for what you're getting.
customer_reviews.author: George White

customer_reviews.title: This is the only way to keep your crypto safe!
customer_reviews.text: Trazor is the way to keep your cripto in a safe place, I wish it were to support more coins. Tip: remember that the hardware wallet is only a "window" to the blockchain, which means that all your coins are attached to your seeds Seeds is what you HAVE TO save in a piece of paper in a different location in case of desaster, so you can then recover with another trazor if necessary ..
customer_reviews.author: MediaBoxEnt

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, easy to use cold storage. Tiny screen is difficult to read.
customer_reviews.text: Great cold storage for my crypto, very easy to use and set up. I wish the screen was bigger since the text that shows on it is microscopically tiny (I'm old and very nearsighted, lol) but it works great!
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Infected trezor
customer_reviews.text: One of the trezors I bought was infected with a virus. It asked me for my seed (code words to restore the trezor) after using it the third time. It told me the trezor was damaged. I put in random incorrect words and it let me bypass as though it fixed the problem. Thankfully I didn't have any coin on it.
customer_reviews.author: worldexplorer

customer_reviews.title: I am not extremely savvy when it comes to any ...
customer_reviews.text: I am not extremely savvy when it comes to any computer devices, but with a little youtube study, I was able to perform a test transfer to my Trezor. I have not done any extensive transfer yet but believe this to be a solid device.
customer_reviews.author: Dave P

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The trezor works great but the actual hardware is flimsy. In less than 3 months the piece connecting the trezor to my keychain broke.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than expected! Setup was a little time consuming but was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Steiger

customer_reviews.title: not that easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use it for a delisted coin. Customer service told me it can receive it. They just didn't tell me how to set it up for it. When I asked how, they said I can do it easily. Great help morons
customer_reviews.author: Peter Kopik

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars. Im lovin it !
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use and makes keeping Crypto currencies very mobile. passcode protection and if you lose your device you have a way to retrieve your lost info as long as you follow the rules. I love it. Its small and stays on my key chain. Kinda like the size of a car remote starter/door opener. I always hated the idea of keeping my crypto currency on my laptop or even on a thumb drive. I feel safe as heck now.
customer_reviews.author: Vanilla Sky

customer_reviews.title: Great Hardware Wallet
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little hardware wallet for the price. Offers a wide range of coins and sounds like they are even adding more. Keep in mind that if your Trezor dies you might want a back up, so it is worth buying two so if your primary dies you just have to put your recovery seed in the second one and away you go. There some sites out there that claim you can enter your seed and get your coins out, but I wouldn't trust them personally. I saw some people ask so I figured I would just mention the Trezor One is powered by the USB connection so does not have an internal battery of any sorts.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W

customer_reviews.title: From a Crypto Trader
customer_reviews.text: The Trezor Wallet is very secure in protecting many kinds of cryptocurrencies. However, it does not support as many currencies as other wallets and its Ethereum wallet is thru a third party, making it very confusing.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: I have no access to my Ehter wallet !
customer_reviews.text: Firstly This device only works first time you plug in the browser, if you ever forgot your pin or had to unplug it and try reconnect it, then the browser woudln't recognize the device, it was very terriable and diffcult to use. Secondly and most importally, it doesnt not have native Ether wallet, and now I cannot access my Ether wallet ! it's stuck on the unlocking screen
customer_reviews.author: Jin H.

customer_reviews.title: Bricked: No Linux Support
customer_reviews.text: Worthless out of the box due to zero support for Linux. Trezor provides no support for Mint, Ubuntu, Debian, or Arch environments. You will be frustrated to learn that there are only two interfaces to this product; one is using a Chrome extension that is being phased out in a few weeks. The replacement software, the Trezor Bridge, is quite difficult to install on Linux - steer clear unless you are an expert-level Python programmer. The average user will not be able to get the wallet to function in Linux.
customer_reviews.author: wink

customer_reviews.title: It's ok...
customer_reviews.text: ..but it doesn't nativly store etherium and eth based coins...it connects through myetherwallet. hopefully they can implement their own ether storage and also support popular alt coins.
customer_reviews.author: Ry

customer_reviews.title: Finally set up my wallet. I'm paranoid about security ...
customer_reviews.text: Finally set up my wallet. I'm paranoid about security so it took me a while to decide which computer to use. PIN keypad randomized each time and the numbers only appear on the device itself. Seed words also only appear on the device. There doesn't seem to be any battery as the wallet only shows a display when connected via a USB power source. Entire setup , including carefully verifying the seed passphrase, took maybe 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: I don't call 911

customer_reviews.title: An absolute must
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to keep some crypto safe, COLD storage is an absolute must. IMHO there are only 2 choices. This and The Nano. I have both and Both are great. I think I prefer the Trezor, but its also more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Nice affordable hw wallet
customer_reviews.text: Great hardware wallet for hodling coin. Flawless transfer of bitcoin. Not a fan of my LTC transfers requiring altering the key through a third party app.. Recommend for people wanting to store crypto offline (esp BTC) at a low price.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use software / instructions
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use software / instructions, and I now feel safer than if I had left my coins in an exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Acitizen

customer_reviews.title: I think this is very good and recommend you to buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Verified Purchase Very happy with this product Works as advertised and very easy to use. Worth the price in peace of mind knowing your bitcoins are safe. I also own the Ledger Nano S. Although both are effective, i find Trezor easier to use overall. The one Con, storing ETH not as easy on Trezor as the Ledger Nano S.I think it is very easy to use and recommend you to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Carter

customer_reviews.title: Seems To Work
customer_reviews.text: Does everything its supposed to do. I'm just not comfortable with this new technology yet. Does take a bit of computer savvy and understanding of cyber currency. Before you buy just YouTube instructions to better understand set up and usage.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product!  Amazing Company!  Keep Your Crypto Assets Safe With Trezor!
customer_reviews.text: If you have any thought at all about buying cryptocurrencies, you want to make sure you have a safe and secure way to store it. In my opinion, personally maintaining your private keys is vital to the security and integrity of your crypto assets. For that reason, this Trezor device is the way to go. I've had this for over 8 months now and it has worked great the entire time. 100% recommended. Even though there is a new model available, this one is still a great option to keep in your arsenal. Good Luck!
customer_reviews.author: GroomReviews

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a safe wallet for my crypto and was this was recommended from a friend. Initial setup was not smooth but after to going to their website I was able to get it all up and running in a few minutes. I would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Karl Beyer

customer_reviews.title: I appreciate that SatoshiLabs open sourced their hardware as well ...
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate that SatoshiLabs open sourced their hardware as well as their software, so went with Trezor over a Ledger. The rate at which new coins are added leaves something to be desired, but that's a software concern and software gets updates.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin F.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Merchant With First Rate Service & Products
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loves the products, pricing, and first rate customer service. I cannot stress the outstanding experiences I have had with The Crypto Merchant. They stand behind their products 100%! Thoroughly recommend to everyone! And a special shout out to Gabe!!!
customer_reviews.author: Florida Gal

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Rubbish item. Worked the first time durin FM installation. Transferred bitcoins into it. Decided to login some time later and the display screen keeps saying “connect device “ Now I can’t connect device because it’s not recognized and I have bitcoins stucked in it. It’s rubbish. Don’t buy
customer_reviews.author: Andrew E.

customer_reviews.title: 2 cents more of plastic in the manufacturing would have made for a much better feel.
customer_reviews.text: Not many options. This works okay but it ships with a tiny cord - I guess this works if you're on a laptop - but I was literally running back and forth around my desk on my iMac to set it up. Nothing is really clear and it's surprisingly cheaply made. Probably $0.2 cents more of plastic in the manufacturing would have made for a much better feel.
customer_reviews.author: Rice

customer_reviews.title: cant even store one of the top 3 crypto on the market
customer_reviews.text: I waited 3 weeks to get this (overseas) been hoarding crypto so I can store in cold storage. This has every other coin but no XRP a #3 coin on the market and now stuck with a POS paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: carnivore

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best hardware wallet out there!
customer_reviews.text: Been testing the Trezor and the Ledger Nano S, Trezor is the clear winner tho I wish they had a mobile App connected to it...
customer_reviews.author: Xof

customer_reviews.title: Works As Advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I believe this device was originally meant just for bitcoin. However, you can transfer other cryptos from a hot wallet to the Trezor. For example, I was able to easily move Ether from an crypto exchange to the Trezor by using the MyEtherWallet interface. Great device!
customer_reviews.author: Roderick the Polymath

customer_reviews.title: Very secure way to store BTC. The only issue ...
customer_reviews.text: Very secure way to store BTC. The only issue I had, was that it was a bit confusing storing Etherium. I did figure it out eventually, but my Etherium stayed on the exchange for a few days until I was able to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done but cheap
customer_reviews.text: It works well but it looks and feels cheap. Also was not easy to figure out how to use it but once you get it it’s actually a good system. I just expect it to be more steady and solid piece.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plastic case feels and looks cheap.
customer_reviews.text: This should have been built with a steel case, not plastic. It works just as advertised, but has flimsy USB case and connection.
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: Not decided yet
customer_reviews.text: It arrived on time. I have not consolidated everything on it yet. I am wanting to make sure I will not lose it. It's small enough to carry but large enough that you might want to store it somewhere and only carry it when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: The installation process is not tedious, but is also not expedient
customer_reviews.text: This hardware wallet has fulfilled all my expectations for it. The installation process is not tedious, but is also not expedient. It took a little while for my cognitive capacity to understand how the password access process works, but once you've got it, you've got it. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: captainwinters

customer_reviews.title: Doen't store a crypto I own
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed to discover the Trezor One does not support XRP. Was a list ever provided for the cryptos supported and I missed it?
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Anne Page

customer_reviews.title: I'm very satisfied with Trezor device
customer_reviews.text: I'm very satisfied with Trezor device. It's so easy to use and being a very safe wallet. I put all my coins in this device. Before buying this wallet, i read a lot about many different wallets, and finally i chose Trezor. Very happy with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: A Great Intro into Hardware Wallets
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it can't be beat. This is my first hardware wallet and I had no problems figuring out how it works. Its about the safest way possible to store crypto assets. Pick up a Trezor and sleep sound with your crypto safe from hackers!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Protect your keys
customer_reviews.text: Trezor is easy to use and intuitive. Nice security features including a random pin and manual signing on the device. Any hackers sniffing around your coins can pound salt. It makes crypto transactions easy and stress free. Do the small amount of work and protect your coins.
customer_reviews.author: Baumer

customer_reviews.title: Lock up some crypto!
customer_reviews.text: Locked up some BTC. Can lock quite a few more currencies. Firmware sometimes bricks the device. No big deal though.
customer_reviews.author: Don Giovanni

customer_reviews.title: Would really love it if this held more alt coins
customer_reviews.text: Would really love it if this held more alt coins, however the actual device works great and is very helpful!
customer_reviews.author: K. Sayler

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable build and working well so far. Problem with Android.
customer_reviews.text: No issues so far and much more confident having a hard wallet for crypto. Build is reasonable. The only issue I have is connecting to my Android device. 3rd party software used for management and cannot seem to recognize my accounts.
customer_reviews.author: gb_ott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! I have since sold all my bitcoin but it sure did keep my coins safe! It gives piece of mind knowing you won’t get messed up with someone stealing your bitcoin from your online wallet.
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN A STOKES

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: If you have any Cryptocurrency that you would like to keep safe, this is your product. Just works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Esmir M.

customer_reviews.title: Satisifed
customer_reviews.text: I really like this wallet, it is my first wallet ever and I am very satisfied with my purchase. My only issue is that I can't buy crypto directly from them because of the state that I live in, a law that prevents me from buying directly from them but otherwise than that I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Seriously people, don't waste your time or money on this piece of garbage. Fails to be recognized by the computer after set up. Very frustrating. Google how to make your own cold storage cypto wallet with a usb stick or a raspberry pi, way cheaper and easier than this piece of trash.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and use
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a secure solution for storing bitcoin so I purchased this hardware wallet. It took about 10 minutes to setup with writing and verifying the 24 secret words. Receiving and sending bitcoins is super easy with the Trezor wallet interface. I feel safer with this hardware wallet instead of storing them on a device that is always connected to the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Razz

customer_reviews.title: Love the tamper proof packaging and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: Solid hardware wallet. Love the tamper proof packaging and ease of use. Do your research, but always include this device as a comparison. I will definitely buy one or two more!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hackenberg

customer_reviews.title: Words cannot describe how great the device
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Trezor device I ordered. Words cannot describe how great the device, the company, the support and just the overall experience of owning it has been. I'm currently waiting for Model T to arrive since it's available now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: if not the best hardware wallets for cold storing your crypto
customer_reviews.text: One of, if not the best hardware wallets for cold storing your crypto. Supports the big players in the crypto world but could use more support for additional coins. Software can sometimes be wonky but overall works with few issues.
customer_reviews.author: J.G.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and very easy to use. Worth the price in peace of mind knowing your bitcoins are safe. I also own the Ledger Nano S. Although both are effective, i find Trezor easier to use overall. The one Con, storing ETH not as easy on Trezor as the Ledger Nano S.
customer_reviews.author: Miles M

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Cheap Quality, Overpriced, No support for XRP unless you buy the $150 version. Scam Company.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as promised
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. Would not connect. Tried with chromebook, hp laptop, and android phone. Frustrating as hell. And their tech support was no help. Got a ballet wallet for cold storage instead, much less stress.
customer_reviews.author: alan5252

customer_reviews.title: Buy it. Own your private keys!
customer_reviews.text: Everything you need comes in the box. The interface is smooth and easy to understand. I would recommend this if you would like to be the owner of your private key.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: The only complaint is that like others said the short cable that came with it ...
customer_reviews.text: Thankful to have it. The only complaint is that like others said the short cable that came with it didn't work out of the box. I had to use one I already had for something else.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: I feel much more secure with a hardware wallet. ...
customer_reviews.text: I feel much more secure with a hardware wallet. I also appreciate that this works with my Android phone. You just need a USB on-the-go cable, which I got on Amazon by a company called OKRAY.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Best you can get!
customer_reviews.text: For someone who has been into cryptocurrency for a while, an offline wallet is a must! This is a great alternative. Its easy to setup, secure, and the app allows you to seemlessly manage your wallets on multiple platforms.
customer_reviews.author: No info given

customer_reviews.title: Has to be the most secure device I have ever ...
customer_reviews.text: Has to be the most secure device I have ever seen. My only complaint would be that I can't figure out how to also use it to store Ethers, which you can supposedly do now.
customer_reviews.author: E. L. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Kinda hard to get the hang of it but once you do it's pretty straightforward
customer_reviews.text: Good deal Kinda hard to get the hang of it but once you do it's pretty straightforward
customer_reviews.author: Jmt

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. Hope this device is supported for years to come. Waiting on Monero support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Go safe
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice. I am still trying to learn how to used this. I hope the company to create more options during time to be able to store more data. Over all is a great product, secure, fast and user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: george santiago

customer_reviews.title: Security first is obvious
customer_reviews.text: It's obvious that the security first mantra of the Trezor One influences its design and UX. I feel good with my cryptocurrency being kept on it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Arnott

customer_reviews.title: works great. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: works great. Highly recommend. I also have the ledger nano S. I like this better, simpler to use and better design.
customer_reviews.author: Holliday

customer_reviews.title: Best crypto wallet
customer_reviews.text: Its a bit arcane to update firmware and setup, but in exchange for that effort you get EXCELLENT security and capability.
customer_reviews.author: pilotSteve

customer_reviews.title: Received quickly from seller. The product was brand new ...
customer_reviews.text: Received quickly from seller. The product was brand new in the box. Well designed and smaller than expected. I have not added bitcoin to the device yet but security is well established this far.
customer_reviews.author: J. taylor

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: I bought the trezor and connected it to my Mac. A second later it shut off and never turned on again. I would not recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Derryc Winston

customer_reviews.title: Works great, keeps my Bitcoin safe from those scum sucking ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, keeps my Bitcoin safe from those scum sucking vermin hackers that would see to steal from me. They are thwarted! Muhahaha! /8-)
customer_reviews.author: M. Pfeifer

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I really like it and I trust it. I am maynely using eth and using MEW for it and could make a custom token on it so I like it but I would really like to see a full support fot erc-20 tokens but not go through third party software.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product to keep tokens / coins safe.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works perfectly and is very easy to install. It you need to keep your tokens / coins off an exchange this is a great product. Make sure you verify that your token will work with this.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Something to have to have if you have crypto-currencies. I feel safer knowing I have control over my investments.
customer_reviews.author: candelier

customer_reviews.title: Too cool. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Don't know how I survived without one of these. Too cool. Easy to use. Secure!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Hoyt Plunkett

customer_reviews.title: A big vault for your crypto currencies
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for a true crypto investor. This will protect the vast wealth you will be accumulating while investing in cryptos!
customer_reviews.author: Thrive On

customer_reviews.title: Feel MUCH more secure now.
customer_reviews.text: Product is great. Encrypted passcode looks amazing and was able to effortlessly transfer my bitcoin and litecoin over to a much safer place. I don't really understand the transfer of ethereum, as I don't like to use third party sites to do so. I just kept it in my wallet and watching it grow.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bergholdt

customer_reviews.title: Came sealed and secure as expected
customer_reviews.text: I now own two and they are a pleasure to use. I also own a Ledger and I prefer the Trezor.
customer_reviews.author: SynePDX

product_meta.title: Trezor One - Cryptocurrency Hardware Wallet - The Most Trusted Cold Storage for Bitcoin, Ethereum, ERC20 and Many More (White)
product_meta.description:
Color:White

TREZOR ONE CRYPTOCURRENCY WALLET WHITE the popular original hardware wallet for securely managing, storing, and using your private keys. Super easy and intuitive to use. Works flawlessly with Windows, macOS, and Linux. Trezor has been the original and the best crypto hardware wallet since 2014, made easy for every user to start using it right away. Comes with instructions and a USB cable. The easy to see bright OLED screen gives you enough space for 6 lines of text. Lets you do complex transactions on a single screen without wasting time scrolling to other screens. Trezor uses a small isolated environment that requires you to physically approve transactions. Highly effective in eliminating the threat of hackers, keyloggers, viruses, and malware that can steal your information and cryptocurrencies.

PRODUCT FEATURES



 * Trezor One Cryptocurrency Wallet White
 * Hardware wallet for cryptocurrency
 * Highly secure environment isolated from online threats
 * Lets you physically approve transactions
 * Protects you against hackers, viruses, malware, bots
 * Works seamlessly with Windows, macOS, Linux
 * Comes with simple instructions and a USB Cable
 * Affordable advanced protection
 * Every 5 minutes a bitcoin is stolen - protect your cryptocurrency now
 * Compact and lightweight
 * Easy to carry in a pocket, purse, backpack, or briefcase
 * Works perfectly for both experts and new users



100% MONEY BACK GUARANTEE ensures this will be your best bet for a pleasing no-risk purchase. This makes a treasured gift for friends, family, and co-workers interested in cryptocurrencies.
feature_bullets: SECURELY PROTECTS against hackers, viruses, keyloggers, and more. Simple backup that restores all device content in case of loss or theft. Super easy to use with a simple 3-step setup. Works for cold storage and, thanks to its mobile connectivity, as a hot wallet for whenever you need instant access to cryptocurrency, passwords, and keys.

MAKE SECURE CRYPTOCURRENCY TRANSACTIONS without fear of hackers or malware gaining access to your assets. The private keys to your cryptoassets never leave the device. Eliminates the nightmare and endless hours of hassle a break-in can cause. The hardware wallet creates a secure offline environment, completely isolated from the internet and its dangers. Trezor uses its screen to let you visually verify and manually confirm all actions.

UNIVERSALLY COMPATIBLE with Windows, macOS, and Linux. Trezor provides everything you need to fully enjoy and utilize modern cryptography to secure your digital assets. Comes with clear instructions and a USB cable. Ready to plug in and use immediately. This is the affordable protection you need when using cryptocurrency.

COMPACT & LIGHTWEIGHT sized at just 2.4 x 1.2 x 0.2 inches. Weighs less than half an ounce. Perfect for carrying in a briefcase, backpack, purse, or pocket. Sports a 120 MHz embedded ARM processor Cortex M3 running a custom developed system. The bright OLED screen is 128x64 pixels with up to 6 lines of text. Lets you see all your information in a single screen.

100% MONEY BACK GUARANTEE ensures this will quickly become your favorite no-risk purchase. Please return unused. This makes a fine birthday gift, holiday present, or anniversary gift for anyone who values exceptional security for confident, no stress crypto transactions.
